metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40962 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Nika Layzell, Timothy Nikkel, Sebastian Hengst, AndreasPehrson, and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs presentin Firefox 104 and Firefox ESR 102.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence ofmemory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of thesecould have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affectsFirefox ESR < 102.3, Thunderbird < 102.3, and Firefox < 105.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required
